etymologies: late 18th century: from French, from the verb provenir ‘come or stem from’, from Latin provenire, from pro- ‘forth’ + venire ‘come’

definitions: the place of origin or earliest known history of something

examples.text: an orange rug of Iranian provenance

shortDefinitions: place of origin or earliest known history of something

definitions: the beginning of something's existence; something's origin

examples.text: they try to understand the whole universe, its provenance and fate

definitions: a record of ownership of a work of art or an antique, used as a guide to authenticity or quality

examples.text: the manuscript has a distinguished provenance

shortDefinitions: record of ownership of work of art
